symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons
symbols.description: SAP UI library: sap.suite.ui.commons

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.AriaProperties
nodes.description: AriaProperties provides ARIA-compliant properties for screen reader software that can be added to any control renderer.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.BulletChart
nodes.description: Chart that displays an actual value as a horizontal bar in semantic color on the top of the background bar, the numeric value, the scaling factor, along with the thresholds, and a target value as vertical bars.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.BusinessCard
nodes.description: This control allows you to display business card information including an image, first title (either URL link or text), second title, and multiple text lines.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilder
nodes.description:
Calculation Builder allows you to perform arithmetic calculations on constants and variables using standard arithmetic operators as well as most common logical operators and functions.
You can customize the sets of variables and functions that are visible in the calculation builder and introduce your own custom functions, as needed.
Arithmetic expressions can be entered using a touch-friendly visual editor or a textual editor that provides autocomplete suggestions for variables and checks the expression syntax as you type.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderComparisonOperatorType
nodes.description: Comparison operators supported by the calculation builder.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderFunction
nodes.description:
A custom function to be used in the calculation builder.
The default functions available for the calculation builder are defined in sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderFunctionType.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderFunctionType
nodes.description:
Functions supported by the calculation builder.
To add a custom function, use sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderFunction.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderGroup
nodes.description: A variable group is used to organize the variables that the user can insert into the sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilder expression.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderItem
nodes.description: Each of the items used as building blocks to create an arithmetic expression in the calculation builder.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderItemType
nodes.description: The types of items (operands) that can be used in a calculation builder expression.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderLayoutType
nodes.description: Layout of the calculation builder.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderLogicalOperatorType
nodes.description: Logical operators supported by the calculation builder.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderOperatorType
nodes.description: Arithmetic operators supported by the calculation builder.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderValidationMode
nodes.description: Types of expression validation that define when the expression entered into the sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilder is validated.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderValidationResult
nodes.description:
This control can be used for creating your own validation algorithm for custom functions.
Custom functions can be defined using sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderFunction.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderVariable
nodes.description: A variable used in the expression entered into the calculation builder.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ChartContainer

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.MicroProcessFlow
nodes.description:
The MicroProcessFlow control can be used to track the progress of a process.
It is best used for linear processes, such as document, order, and approval flows, and can be embedded in tiles, tables, and other containers.

To display more complex processes and workflows, use sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlow instead.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.AriaProperties
symbols.description: AriaProperties provides ARIA-compliant properties for screen reader software that can be added to any control renderer.

properties.name: describedBy
properties.description: Identifies one or more elements that describe the object. See the related labelledBy property.

properties.name: hasPopup
properties.description: Indicates that the element has a popup context menu or a submenu.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Defines a string value that labels the current element. See the related labelledBy property.

properties.name: labelledBy
properties.description: Identifies one or more elements that label the current element. See the related label and describedBy properties.

properties.name: role
properties.description: Identifies the element role.

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new AriaProperties.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.BusinessCard

symbols.title: class sap.suite.ui.commons.BusinessCard
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.32
symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.32. Deprecated. Standard Fiori technology should be used.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilder
symbols.description:
Calculation Builder allows you to perform arithmetic calculations on constants and variables using standard arithmetic operators as well as most common logical operators and functions.
You can customize the sets of variables and functions that are visible in the calculation builder and introduce your own custom functions, as needed.
Arithmetic expressions can be entered using a touch-friendly visual editor or a textual editor that provides autocomplete suggestions for variables and checks the expression syntax as you type.

properties.name: allowComparisonOperators
properties.description: Defines whether comparison operators (<, >, <=, >=, =, !=) are allowed.

properties.name: allowLogicalOperators
properties.description: Defines whether logical operators (AND, OR, XOR, NOT) are allowed.

properties.name: allowStringConstants
properties.description:
Defines whether string constants are allowed.
If set to true, the calculation builder doesn't validate custom strings as errors.

properties.name: allowSuggestions
properties.description: Defines whether autocomplete suggestions are shown when you type. Available only for desktop devices.

properties.name: disabledDefaultTokens
properties.description:
Default operators or functions that are disabled. Delimiter for multiple items is ';'.
Example of usage: +;-;sqrt

properties.name: expression
properties.description:
Holds the arithmetic expression.
Use either this property or aggregation Items. Not both.

properties.name: layoutType
properties.description:
Defines the layout type used for the calculation builder.
The layout may include a visual editor, a text editor, or both. In addition, you can set the text editor to be read-only.

properties.name: readOnly
properties.description: Defines whether the control is read-only.

properties.name: showInputToolbar
properties.description:
Defines whether the input toolbar is visible.
The input toolbar contains operators and functions that can be used in the expression.

properties.name: showToolbar
properties.description: Defines whether the toolbar is visible.

properties.name: title
properties.description: The title of the calculation builder element.

properties.name: validationMode
properties.description:
Defines when the expression is validated.

  • If set to LiveChange, the input is validated as you type.
  • If set to FocusOut, the input is validated, once you press Enter or Tab.

properties.name: wrapItemsInExpression
properties.description:
Defines whether the expression should be wrapped inside the calculation builder field.
If set to false, the expression is rearranged into a single scrollable row.

aggregations.name: functions
aggregations.description: Holds the custom functions that can be used in the calculation builder.

aggregations.name: groups
aggregations.description:
Defines groups of variables.
Variables can be organized into multiple groups for better orientation among different types of variables.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: Holds the items (operators and operands) to be displayed in the calculation builder.

aggregations.name: operators
aggregations.description:
Holds additional operators defined by the application.
These operators are not validated.

aggregations.name: variables
aggregations.description: Holds the variables that can be used in the calculation builder.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new calculation builder.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: afterValidation
events.description: This event is fired after the expression is validated.

events.name: change
events.description: This event is fired when the order of items changes, or when some items are added or removed.

events.name: validateFunction
events.description:
This event is fired for each custom function included in the expression.
Custom functions can be defined using sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderFunction and validated using sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderValidationResult.

Sets a new value for property validationMode.

Defines when the expression is validated.

  • If set to LiveChange, the input is validated as you type.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is LiveChange.

Default value is true.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderFunction
symbols.description:
A custom function to be used in the calculation builder.
The default functions available for the calculation builder are defined in sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderFunctionType.

properties.name: description
properties.description:
Description of the function.
The description is displayed in the functions menu on the calculation builder's toolbar. If no description is specified, it is generated automatically based on the key property and the parameters defined in the items aggregation.

properties.name: key
properties.description:
A key associated with the function. This property is mandatory.
The key is displayed in the text editor area of the calculation builder.

properties.name: label
properties.description:
Label for the function.
The label is displayed in the visual editor of the calculation builder and in the functions menu on the calculation builder's toolbar.

properties.name: useDefaultValidation
properties.description:
Defines whether default validation should be used.
Set this property to false to provide your own validation algorithm using sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderValidationResult.
If you do not provide your own validation algorithm for this custom function, set this property to true, and the function will be validated by the calculation builder.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description:
Holds the parameters that can be passed to the function.
For example, if the function has two parameters, the items aggregation may consist of:

  1. A sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderItem with an empty key for the first argument entered by the user.
  2. A sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderItem with a "," (comma) key for the comma that separates the arguments.
  3. A sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderItem with an empty key for the second argument entered by the user.

symbols.title: class sap.suite.ui.commons.CalculationBuilderVariable

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ChartContainer
symbols.description: Provides a toolbar with generic functions for tables and charts based on the VizFrame control like zoom, display in fullscreen mode, toggle the legend, switch between chart types, and changes of the chart dimension. The controls of the content aggregation are positioned below the toolbar. Additional functions can be added to the toolbar with the customIcons aggregation.

properties.name: autoAdjustHeight
properties.description: Determine whether to stretch the chart height to the maximum possible height of ChartContainer's parent container. As a prerequisite, the parent container needs to have a fixed value height or be able to determine height from its parent.

properties.name: enableScroll
properties.description: If set to true, the Container control has its own scroll bar, with the scrolling taking place within the Container control itself.

properties.name: fullScreen
properties.description: Display the chart and the toolbar in full screen or normal mode.

properties.name: selectorGroupLabel
properties.description: Custom Label for Selectors Group.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.32.0. Obsolete property as sap.m.Toolbar is replaced by sap.m.OverflowToolbar.

properties.name: showFullScreen
properties.description: Set to true to display the full screen icon. Set to false to hide it.

properties.name: showLegend
properties.description: Set to true to display the charts' legends. Set to false to hide them. See also showLegendButton.

properties.name: showLegendButton
properties.description: Set to true or false to display or hide a button for controlling the visbility of the chart's legend. Please be aware that setting this property to true indirectly is setting showLegend to false. If you need to hide the button but to show the legend, you need to set showLegend at a later point in time (onBeforeRendering). The execution order of the combined properties is not guaranteed by the control.

properties.name: showPersonalization
properties.description: Set to true to display the personalization icon. Set to false to hide it.

properties.name: showSelectionDetails
properties.description:
Set to true to display the 'Details' button that opens a popup dialog with details about the selected data from the VizFrame based chart.

Since: 1.48.0.

properties.name: showZoom
properties.description: Set to true to display zoom icons. Set to false to hide them.

properties.name: title
properties.description: String shown if there are no dimensions to display.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the Container.

properties.name: wrapLabels
properties.description:
Set to true to wrap text labels in the dialog that opens when the user clicks or taps the 'Details' button.

Since: 1.58.0.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: ChartToolBar Content aggregation. Only sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame, sap.m.Table and sap.ui.table.Table can be embedded. If not specified explicitly, the rendering order of the charts is determined by the sequence of contents provided by the application via this aggregation. This means, per default the first chart of the aggregation will be rendered within the container.

aggregations.name: customIcons
aggregations.description: This aggregation contains the custom icons that should be displayed additionally on the toolbar. It is not guaranteed that the same instance of the sap.ui.core.Icon control will be used within the toolbar, but the toolbar will contain a sap.m.OverflowToolbarButton with an icon property equal to the src property of the sap.ui.core.Icon provided in the aggregation. If a press event is triggered by the icon displayed on the toolbar, then the press handler of the original sap.ui.core.Icon control is used. The instance of the control, that has triggered the press event, can be accessed using the "controlReference" parameter of the event object.

aggregations.name: dimensionSelectors
aggregations.description: Dimension Selects.

aggregations.name: toolbar
aggregations.description: Overflow ToolBar. If an external toolbar is used, it will be integrated with the embedded toolbar via a placeholder. This placeholder is mandatory, and it needs to be of type 'sap.suite.ui.commons.ChartContainerToolbarPlaceholder'.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.DateRangeScroller
symbols.description: The DateRangeScroller provides a method to scroll through a series of time periods, each of which is represented by a starting date and an ending date, known as the date range. The user may scroll to the previous or next date range. Several predefined ranges are supported such as day, week, work week, month, and year.

associations.name: ariaDescribedBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new DateRangeScroller.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: change

parameters.name: dateRange
parameters.description: Object containing startDate and endDate Date properties signifying the start and ending dates of the currently selected range.

events.description: This event is fired whenever the date range is changed.

methods.name: addAriaDescribedBy

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: vAriaDescribedBy
parameters.description: The ariaDescribedBy to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

methods.description: Adds some ariaDescribedBy into the association ariaDescribedBy.

methods.name: addAriaLabelledBy

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: vAriaLabelledBy
parameters.description: The ariaLabelledBy to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

methods.description: Adds some ariaLabelledBy into the association ariaLabelledBy.

methods.name: attachChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.suite.ui.commons.DateRangeScroller itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the change event of this sap.suite.ui.commons.DateRangeScroller.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.suite.ui.commons.DateRangeScroller itself.

This event is fired whenever the date range is changed.

methods.name: decrementDateRange

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining

methods.description: Decrement the date range by a time period increment according to the the date range type and fire the dateChange event.

methods.name: detachChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the change event of this sap.suite.ui.commons.DateRangeScroller.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: setDateFormat

parameters.name: oDateFormat
parameters.description: Date format which should be used

methods.description: Setter for dateFormat which is used for formating the dates If passed object is null or is of incorrect type, control's default formatting will be used.

methods.name: setDateRangeCustom

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: dInitialDate
parameters.description: The initial date for the custom range.

parameters.name: iDuration
parameters.description: The number of days in the custom range, including the start date.

methods.description: Set a custom date range beginning with the specified start date that increments/decrements iDuration days at a time.

methods.name: setDateRangeDay

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: dInitialDate
parameters.description: The initial date.

methods.description: Set a date range equal to a single day, starting with the given initial date.

methods.name: setDateRangeMonth

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: dInitialDate
parameters.description: Any date that falls within the desired month.

methods.description: Set a date range that increments/decrements one calendar month at a time. The month date range begins on the first day of the month (beginning of the day) and ends on the last day of the month (end of the day).

methods.name: setDateRangeWeek

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: dInitialDate
parameters.description: Any date that falls on the desired week. Start/end dates will be adjusted according to the first day of the week.

parameters.name: oSettings
parameters.description: Settings for the object

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The number of days in the range with a minimum of 1 and maximum of 7.

parameters.name: iFirstDayOfWeek
parameters.description: The starting day for the range. Valid values are 0-6, with 0=Sunday and 6=Saturday.

methods.description:
Set a date range that steps one week at a time. The starting date is set according to the first day of the week (default is Monday) and the initial date. For example, if the first day of the week is set to Tuesday and the initial date is Wednesday, January 9, 2013, then the starting date will be Tuesday, January 8, 2013.

The last day of the range is calculated by adding (duration - 1) days to the starting date.

methods.name: setDateRangeYear

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: dInitialDate
parameters.description: Any date that falls within the desired year.

methods.description: Set a date range that increments/decrements one calendar year at a time. The year date range begins on the first day of the year (beginning of the day) and ends on the last day of the year (end of the day).

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.DateRangeSlider
symbols.description: The Date Range Slider provides the user with a Range Slider control that is optimized for use with Dates.

properties.name: editable
properties.description: This property switches the enabled state of the control. Using the date range slider interactively requires this property to be true.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: This property switches the enabled state of the control. Disabled fields have different colors, and can not be focused.

properties.name: labels
properties.description: Labels to be displayed instead of dates.

properties.name: max
properties.description: Maximum date for the slider.

properties.name: min
properties.description: Minimum date for the slider.

properties.name: pinGrip
properties.description: Pin the left grip so that user cannot move it with the keyboard or mouse.

properties.name: pinGrip2
properties.description: Pin the right grip so that user cannot move it with the keyboard or mouse.

properties.name: showBubbles
properties.description: Property to show or hide bubbles. Default is true.

properties.name: smallStepWidth
properties.description: The grips of the control can only be moved in steps of this width.

properties.name: stepLabels
properties.description: Display a date label above each tick.

properties.name: totalUnits
properties.description: Number of units between ticks.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Date value of the left grip.

properties.name: value2
properties.description: Date value of the right grip.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: This property switches the visible state of the control. Invisible date range slider are not rendered.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the horizontal date range slider.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new DateRangeSlider.

properties.name: defaultImages
properties.description: A list of default images that is cycled by the control when no image is available for a feed item or when no feed items exist. After a random image is displayed first time, control cycles through this list of images.

properties.name: displayArticleImage
properties.description: To display article Image or not. If it is true, the article Image will be displayed based on precedence. If it is false, the default image will be displayed.

properties.name: displayDuration
properties.description: The length of time in seconds the control displays each feed item. Default value is 5 seconds.

properties.name: source

methods.name: stageModel

parameters.name: oModel
parameters.description: Model of new feed items.

methods.description: Set a new model of feed items, such as when a feed aggregator has collected the latest feed items. This model is staged (not immediately set on the control) to avoid re-rendering before the currently displayed article is faded out. Therefore a smooth transition between the display of feed items is always maintained.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.HeaderContainer
symbols.description: The container that provides a horizontal layout. It provides a horizontal scroll on the tablet and phone. On the desktop, it provides scroll left and scroll right buttons. This control supports keyboard navigation. You can use left and right arrow keys to navigate through the inner content. The Home key puts focus on the first control and the End key puts focus on the last control. Use Enter or Space to choose the control.

properties.name: backgroundDesign
properties.description:
Specifies the background color of the content. The visualization of the different options depends on the used theme.

Since: 1.38.

properties.name: scrollStep
properties.description: Number of pixels to scroll when the user chooses Next or Previous buttons. Relevant only for desktop.

properties.name: scrollTime
properties.description: Scroll animation time in milliseconds.

properties.name: showDividers
properties.description:
If set to true, shows dividers between scrollable items.

Since: 1.25.

properties.name: view
properties.description:
The view of the HeaderContainer. There are two view modes: horizontal and vertical. In horizontal mode the content controls are displayed next to each other, in vertical mode the content controls are displayed on top of each other.

Since: 1.25.

aggregations.name: buttonNext
aggregations.description: Button that allows to scroll to next section.

aggregations.name: buttonPrev
aggregations.description: Button that allows to scroll to previous section.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: Items to add to HeaderContainer.

aggregations.name: scrollContainer
aggregations.description: Scroll container for smooth scrolling on different platforms.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setView

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sView
parameters.description: New value for property view

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property view.

The view of the HeaderContainer. There are two view modes: horizontal and vertical. In horizontal mode the content controls are displayed next to each other, in vertical mode the content controls are displayed on top of each other.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is Horizontal.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.imageeditor.CustomSizeItem
symbols.description: A CustomSizeItem can be used in the sap.suite.ui.commons.imageeditor.ImageEditorContainer aggregations to define custom items on the Resize, Crop Rectangle, and Crop Ellipse panels.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
* Defines the height of the CustomSizeItem.
This property is mandatory and must be greater than 0.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Defines the icon to be displayed in the CustomSizeItem.
If no icon is specified, the default image is used, which is derived from the set width and height.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Defines the label of the CustomSizeItem.

properties.name: relative
properties.description:
Specifies whether the width and height properties use relative values (true) or absolute values (false).
When used in the customResizeItems aggregation of an sap.suite.ui.commons.imageeditor.ImageEditorContainer, width and height are multiplied by the width and height properties of the CustomSizeItem.
When used in the customRectangleCropItems or customEllipseCropItems aggregations of an sap.suite.ui.commons.imageeditor.ImageEditorContainer, aspect ratio is set to the width and height properties of the CustomSizeItem.

properties.name: width
properties.description:
Defines the width of the CustomSizeItem.
This property is mandatory and must be greater than 0.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.imageeditor.ImageEditor
symbols.description: Image editor displays an image and provides API and visual controls to edit it.

properties.name: customShapeSrc
properties.description:
Image source for the custom shape used in custom shape cropping.
Can be a file or Blob object, a URL address of the image, a Base64 data URL string, or any other source supported by the <img> HTML tag.
Note: In Internet Explorer, customShape doesn't support SVG files and will throw and exception if SVG files are used.

properties.name: keepCropAspectRatio
properties.description: Defines whether aspect ratio should be kept when the crop area is expanded or shrunk in the CropRectangle or CropEllipse modes (sap.suite.ui.commons.ImageEditorMode).

properties.name: keepResizeAspectRatio
properties.description: Defines whether aspect ratio should be kept when the image is resized in the Resize mode (sap.suite.ui.commons.ImageEditorMode) or using the #setWidth or #setHeight methods.

properties.name: mode
properties.description:
Image editor mode.
Four modes are available: resize mode, crop to rectangle mode, crop to circle mode, and display image mode (default).
The default mode displays the image to be edited.

properties.name: scaleCropArea
properties.description:
Defines the behavior of the crop area when zooming in or out.
If set to true, the crop area is scaled up or down when the zoom level is changed.
If set to false, the crop area remains unchanged and keeps its size.

properties.name: src
properties.description:
Image source.
Can be a file or Blob object, a URL address of the image, a Base64 data URL string, or any other source supported by the <img> HTML tag.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new ImageEditor.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: cropAreaChanged
events.description: This event is fired when the size of the crop area is changed by the user while in the CropRectangle or CropEllipse mode (sap.suite.ui.commons.ImageEditorMode).

events.name: customShapeError
events.description: This event is fired if there is an error loading the image specified in the customShapeSrc property, for example, when the URL is unreachable.

events.name: customShapeLoaded
events.description: This event is fired after the image specified in the customShapeSrc property is successfully loaded.

events.name: error
events.description: This event is fired if there is an error loading the image specified in the src property, for example, when the URL is unreachable.

events.name: historyChanged
events.description:
This event is fired each time there is a change in the history of recent actions or in the recent actions history index.
This may happen either when an action is performed on the image or when the #undo, #redo, or #jumpToHistory methods are called.

events.name: loaded
events.description: This event is fired after the image specified in the src property is successfully loaded.

events.name: sizeChanged
events.description: This event is fired when the size of the image is changed by the user while in the Resize mode (sap.suite.ui.commons.ImageEditorMode).

events.name: zoomChanged
events.description: This event is fired when the zoom level is changed by the user interaction.

methods.name: applyPreview
methods.description: Saves current preview to action history, if there is any.

methods.name: applyVisibleCrop

parameters.name: bPreview
parameters.description: Indicates whether to show this action in preview only (true) or record it in action history as well (false)

methods.description:
Crops the image based on the currently shown crop area.
This method works only when the sap.suite.ui.commons.ImageEditorMode is set to CropRectangle or CropEllipse.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.suite.ui.commons.imageeditor.ImageEditor itself.

This event is fired when the zoom level is changed by the user interaction.

symbols.title: class sap.suite.ui.commons.imageeditor.ImageEditor

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.imageeditor.ImageEditorContainer
symbols.description:
This control acts as a wrapper around the sap.suite.ui.commons.imageeditor.ImageEditor control. It provides additional image editing capabilities for the convenience of your users.

Toolbar Customization

There are two ways to customize the toolbar, but they cannot be used together:

  • Use enabledButtons property to select the order and visibility of the buttons provided by the ImageEditorContainer control. You can use the customToolbarControls aggregation to add custom controls that will be rendered in the toolbar.
  • Use the #getToolbar method together with the #getToolbarIds method to customize the toolbar as you need.
    The changes made to the toolbar will be kept unless some of the methods from previous approach are used. The previous approach involves rerendering of the toolbar, which causes all changes to be lost. Note: If you use this approach, make sure that you make your changes to the mobile toolbars as well, so that your application can be used on mobile devices.
    There are three mobile toolbars available:
    • The header toolbar that can be customized using the method #getMobileHeaderToolbar and is intended for custom buttons.
    • The zoom toolbar contains zoom functionality that can be customized using the methods #getMobileZoomToolbar and #getMobileZoomToolbarIds.
    • The footer toolbar that usually includes the ImageEditorContainer buttons and can be customized using the methods #getMobileFooterToolbar and #getMobileFooterToolbarIds.

properties.name: enabledButtons
properties.description: Controls order and availability of the buttons in the header panel of ImageEditorContainer.

properties.name: mode
properties.description:
Image editor container mode.
Three modes are available: transform mode, crop mode, and filter mode (default).
The default mode provides filters for image editing: brightness, contrast, saturation, sepia grayscale, and others.

aggregations.name: customEllipseCropItems
aggregations.description: Custom items for Ellipse Crop option panel.

aggregations.name: customRectangleCropItems
aggregations.description: Custom items for Rectangle Crop option panel.

aggregations.name: customResizeItems
aggregations.description: Custom items for Resize option panel.

aggregations.name: customToolbarControls
aggregations.description: Custom controls that are added into the toolbar of ImageEditorContainer. Only use controls that are supported by sap.m.OverflowToolbar.

aggregations.name: imageEditor
aggregations.description:
sap.suite.ui.commons.imageeditor.ImageEditor containing the image for editing.
If no sap.suite.ui.commons.imageeditor.ImageEditor is specified, the ImageEditorContainer has no effect.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.MicroProcessFlow
symbols.description:
The MicroProcessFlow control can be used to track the progress of a process.
It is best used for linear processes, such as document, order, and approval flows, and can be embedded in tiles, tables, and other containers.

To display more complex processes and workflows, use sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlow instead.

properties.name: ariaLabel
properties.description: ARIA label for this control to be used by screen reader software.

properties.name: renderType
properties.description:
Determines how the micro process flow should be rendered inside its parent container.
When the width of the parent container does not allow for all nodes in the micro process flow to be displayed, you can wrap it inside the parent container or add scrolling icons.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the micro process flow.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Icon that is displayed inside the node.
By default, an icon that corresponds to the node's state is used.

properties.description: Key of the node.

properties.name: showIntermediary
properties.description:
Defines whether an object should be displayed between this node and the following node.
When set to true, a vertical red bar is displayed by default. To define custom objects, use the intermediary aggregation.

properties.description: Defines whether a connector line should be displayed between this node and the node that follows it.

properties.name: state
properties.description:
State associated with this node.
The state defines the semantic color applied to the node. Available states include Standard (neutral), Error (negative), Success (positive), and Warning (critical).

properties.name: stepWidth
properties.description:
Distance between this node and the following node.
When set to a percentage value, the distance is calculated based on the height of the parent container.

symbols.title: class sap.suite.ui.commons.MicroProcessFlowItem

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.MicroProcessFlowRenderType
symbols.description:
Options that define how the micro process flow should be rendered inside its parent container.
These options can be useful when the width of the parent container does not allow for all nodes in the micro process flow to be displayed on the same line.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.MicroProcessFlowRenderType.NoWrap
properties.description:
The micro process flow nodes are not wrapped inside the parent container.
The nodes that do not fit into the width of the parent container are not displayed.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.MicroProcessFlowRenderType.Scrolling
properties.description:
Two scrolling icons are added to the parent container, which allows navigation by scrolling through the micro process flow.
Please note that the numbers displayed next to the scrolling icons are not recalculated dynamically when you resize the browser window. If you want them to be recalculated, consider using the ScrollingWithResizer render type instead.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.MicroProcessFlowRenderType.ScrollingWithResizer
properties.description:
Two scrolling icons are added to the parent container, with the number indicators updated automatically when you resize the browser window.
This option allows scrolling through the micro process flow, just as the Scrolling option does, but may slightly affect the performance. If using this render type affects your application's performance, consider using the Scrolling render type instead.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.MicroProcessFlowRenderType.Wrap
properties.description: The micro process flow nodes are wrapped inside the parent container.

symbols.title: enum sap.suite.ui.commons.MicroProcessFlowRenderType

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.Graph
symbols.description: The network graph control allows you to display data as a network of nodes connected by lines. The nodes can be circular or rectangular and can be joined into groups. You can define custom attributes for nodes and groups of nodes as well as apply layout algorithms that define the graph's appearance.

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description: Background color.

properties.name: backgroundImage
properties.description: An image to be rendered on the background.

properties.name: enableWheelZoom
properties.description: If this property is set to false, zooming in or out using the mouse wheel is available only when the Ctrl key is pressed.

properties.name: enableZoom
properties.description: If this property is set to false, zoom buttons are hidden, and the mouse wheel can be used for scrolling only.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the graph. If this property is set to 'auto', the network graph will be resized to fit the height of its content, regardless of the height of the parent control.

properties.name: noData
properties.description:
Set this property to true if you want to notify the user that no data has been loaded.
There is no internal check for data received, so we recommend that you make sure you set it correctly when there is no data received, not just when the application is waiting for data to be retrieved.

properties.name: noDataText
properties.description:
Text displayed when no data is set.
This property takes effect only when the noData property is set to true.

properties.name: orientation
properties.description: Orientation of the graph flow. This property is used by layout algorithms.

properties.name: renderType
properties.description: Nodes rendering type. For optimal performance and usability, it is recommended that you use HTML whenever possible.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the graph. If this property is set to 'auto', the network graph will be resized to fit the width of its content, regardless of the width of the parent control.

aggregations.name: groups
aggregations.description: Holds a list of groups used in the graph.

aggregations.name: layoutAlgorithm
aggregations.description: Defines the layout algorithm to be used. If not defined, sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.layout.LayeredLayout is used.

aggregations.name: legend
aggregations.description: A custom legend to be rendered instead of the autogenerated one.

aggregations.name: lines
aggregations.description: Holds the lines to be displayed in the graph.

aggregations.name: nodes
aggregations.description: Holds the nodes to be displayed in the graph.

aggregations.name: statuses
aggregations.description: Holds a collection of custom statuses that can be used to assign custom colors to nodes, lines, and groups of nodes, based on their status.

associations.name: ariaDescribedBy
associations.description: Controls or IDs that describe this control. This association is used by screen reader software.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Controls or IDs that label this control. This association is used by screen reader software.

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new Graph.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: afterLayouting
events.description: This event is fired when the layouting algorithm has finished arranging the graph and SVG rendering starts.

events.name: beforeLayouting
events.description: This event is fired just before the layout computation begins.

events.name: failure

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of an error. This parameter can be used for decision making in the calling code.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: A human readable message with a description of what went wrong.

events.description: This event is fired when an error has occured and the graph cannot be rendered properly.

events.name: graphReady
events.description: This event is fired when the graph is fully rendered.

events.name: search
events.description: This event is fired when the user enters a keyword into the search field.

events.name: searchSuggest
events.description: This event is fired when the user runs a search and there is a matching term found among the suggestions.

events.name: selectionChange

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: A list of elements that changed the state of the selection. To determine the new state, use the getSelected() method.

events.description: This event is fired when a selection of elements in the graph changes.

events.name: zoomChanged
events.description: This event is fired when zooming in or out.

methods.name: getNoData

returnValue.description: Value of property noData

methods.description:
Gets current value of property noData.

Set this property to true if you want to notify the user that no data has been loaded.
There is no internal check for data received, so we recommend that you make sure you set it correctly when there is no data received, not just when the application is waiting for data to be retrieved.

Default value is false.

Default value is empty string.

symbols.title: class sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.Graph

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.GraphMap
symbols.description: A component which displays an overview of the entire graph and allows users to quickly navigate in the linked graph.

properties.name: directRenderNodeLimit
properties.description: This property affects the threshold at which the renderer switches from link rendering to direct graph rendering. Rendering using xlink is much faster, but with larger graphs it may slow down the browser performance. Modify this property with care. Please also keep in mind that a graph map that is rendered directly does not adapt to changes until it's fully rerendered. Available only for SVG rendering type.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the graph map.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Graph overview title

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the graph map.

associations.name: graph
associations.description: An association to a graph displayed by this component.

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new GraphMap.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.GraphMap itself.

This event is fired when the map is fully rendered.

This property affects the threshold at which the renderer switches from link rendering to direct graph rendering. Rendering using xlink is much faster, but with larger graphs it may slow down the browser performance. Modify this property with care. Please also keep in mind that a graph map that is rendered directly does not adapt to changes until it's fully rerendered. Available only for SVG rendering type.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is 250.

properties.name: collapsed
properties.description: Defines whether the group is collapsed. By default, it is expanded.

properties.name: headerCheckBoxState
properties.description: Defines if the Header checkbox should be displayed and whether it should be selected or not. By default, the checkbox is hidden.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: An icon associated with the group.

properties.name: key
properties.description: The key of the group. This key is used to assign nodes to groups.

properties.name: minWidth
properties.description:
Minimal width of the group (swim lane) for the SwimLanes type of sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.LayoutRenderType.
If not specified, the width of the group (swim lane) is defined automatically, based on the width of the nodes included in the swim lane.
If the width specified in this property is too small to fit the nodes included in this group (swim lane), the width is increased accordingly.

properties.name: parentGroupKey
properties.description: Key of the parent group. Can be used only with the TwoColumns layout.

symbols.title: class sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.layout.ForceBasedLayout

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.layout.ForceDirectedLayout
symbols.description: This algorithm uses the deterministic variant of the force-directed layout algorithm sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.layout.ForceBasedLayout to arrange the nodes included in the network graph. It can be useful for complex graphs, where sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.layout.LayeredLayout is not sufficient.

properties.name: coolDownStep
properties.description: Specifies how much the 'temperature' decreases after every iteration.

properties.name: initialTemperature
properties.description: Initial 'temperature' of the system, that controls the step width of the nodes' movements and that decreases, or 'cools down', after each iteration.

properties.name: maxIterations
properties.description: Maximum number of iterations (or cooldown steps) the layouting process will go through.

properties.name: maxTime
properties.description: Maximum time in milliseconds the layouting process will run for.

properties.name: optimalDistanceConstant
properties.description: The "C" constant from the optimal distance equation used in the Fruchterman-Reingold Algorithm. See https://www.researchgate.net/publication/309193795_Force-Directed_Graph_Drawing_Algorithm

properties.name: staticNodes
properties.description: List of keys of nodes that should ignore cooldown iterations and keep their original positions (x and y coordinates) in the graph.

symbols.title: class sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.layout.ForceDirectedLayout

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.layout.LayeredLayout
symbols.description: This algorithm uses the klay.js algorithm to rearrange the graph in grid form. It's suitable for process flows and tree-like graphs. It can be used for almost any graph.

properties.name: mergeEdges
properties.description: Determines if all lines should lead to the same place in the node, or if each line should point to a different place.

properties.name: nodePlacement
properties.description: A node placement strategy to use (see sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.NodePlacement).

properties.name: nodeSpacing
properties.description: Define a minimal distance on nodes the algorithm will try to keep. The default value is 55. Note that values below 50 are incompatible with presence of groups due to insufficient space for group title bars and space between nodes and their groups' borders.

constructor.description:

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.LayoutRenderType
symbols.description: Types of layout algorithms that define the visual features and layout of the network graph.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.LayoutRenderType.Forces
properties.description:
Algorithm that arranges the nodes freely in a force-directed manner, based on the attractive and repulsive forces within the graph.
This layout algorithm ignores node groups, so all nodes appear as standalone nodes not grouped in any way.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.LayoutRenderType.LayeredWithGroups
properties.description: Algorithm that arranges nodes into layers and ensures support for free-form groups.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.LayoutRenderType.SwimLanes
properties.description: Algorithm that arranges nodes into swim lanes, which are single-layer groups.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.LayoutRenderType.TwoColumns
properties.description: Algorithm that supports nested groups, similar to SwimLanes, but arranges them into two columns only: one on the left and one on the right.

properties.name: arrowOrientation

properties.description: Defines the appearance of the line. Can be set to solid, dashed, or dotted.

properties.description:
Extends the line up to the node's horizontal or vertical axis to ensure that it meets the shape's outline even when a fancy shape is used.
Available for custom nodes only.

aggregations.description: A list of points the line goes through. After the layouting algorithm has finished arranging the graph, this aggregation contains the coordinates of at least two points: the starting point and the end point of the line. The rest of the points making up the line are treated as break points.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.LineArrowOrientation
symbols.description: Direction of the arrow on the connector line.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.LineArrowOrientation.Both
properties.description: The arrows on the line point both ways.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.LineArrowOrientation.ChildOf
properties.description: The arrow points from child to parent.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.LineArrowOrientation.None
properties.description: The arrow is hidden.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.LineArrowOrientation.ParentOf
properties.description: The arrow points from parent to child.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.LineArrowPosition
symbols.description: Position of the arrow on a connector line.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.LineArrowPosition.End
properties.description: The arrow is placed at the end of the last line segment.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.LineArrowPosition.Middle
properties.description: The arrow is placed in the middle of the last line segment. If the line has only one segment, the arrow appears in the middle of the line.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.LineArrowPosition.Start
properties.description: The arrow is placed at the beginning of the first line segment.

properties.description: Dashed connector line.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.LineType.Dotted
properties.description: Dotted connector line.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.LineType.Solid
properties.description: Solid connector line.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.Node
symbols.description: Holds information about one node. When changing the size of the node after the graph is rendered, you have to manually invalidate the graph, which causes the layout algorithm to be applied again.

properties.name: collapsed
properties.description: Defines if the subtree of this node is collapsed. By default, it is expanded.

properties.name: coreNodeSize
properties.description:
Determines the size of a custom node, which can be useful for nodes that have text or other content outside of its shape.
This property is available for custom nodes only.

properties.name: descriptionLineSize
properties.description: Determines the maximum number of lines allowed to be displayed in the node's description. If you want to hide the description, set this property to -1 (default). To display an unlimited number of lines, set this property to 0. This property does not affect the description that appears in the tooltip, which is always fully rendered.

properties.name: group
properties.description: Key of the group where this node is included.

properties.name: headerCheckBoxState
properties.description: Defines if the Header checkbox should be displayed and whether it should be selected or not. By default, the checkbox is hidden. Available only for box nodes.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the node. In circular nodes, it determines the circle diameter.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: An icon associated with the element.

properties.name: iconSize
properties.description: Determines the size of the node's icon. This property can be applied only to circular nodes.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Key of the node. This key is used throughout the DOM to reference this node, mainly in the connector line (Line) elements of the graph.

properties.name: maxWidth
properties.description: Maximum width allowed. The auto grow algorithm stops increasing the width at this value.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Shows if the node is selected. Once the node is selected, its appearance changes slightly to distinguish it from other nodes.

properties.name: shape
properties.description: Shape of the node. The shape is round by default. To create a rectangular node, set this property to Box.

properties.name: showActionLinksButton
properties.description: Determines if the links button is visible.

properties.name: showDetailButton
properties.description: Determines if the details button is visible.

properties.name: showExpandButton
properties.description: Determines if the expand button is visible.

properties.name: statusIcon
properties.description: An additional status icon displayed when the node is collapsed.

properties.name: titleLineSize
properties.description: Determines the maximum number of lines allowed for the node's label. If set to 0, the label may have an unlimited number of lines.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. Node is still used for layouter.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the node. If the width is not defined, the node expands, so it can fit the content.

properties.name: x
properties.description:
The x coordinate of the node. This value must be set after the layout algorithm has finished arranging the graph. It may come from the input data but is not required for most layout algorithms.
Works only for CustomLayout or NoopLayout layout algorithms. Other layout algorithms override this property. However, you can still change it using an afterLayouting event.

properties.name: y
properties.description:
The y coordinate of the node. This value must be set after the layout algorithm has finished arranging the graph. It may come from the input data but is not required for most layout algorithms.
Works only for CustomLayout or NoopLayout layout algorithms. Other layout algorithms override this property. However, you can still change it using an afterLayouting event.

aggregations.name: _checkBox
aggregations.description: Internal aggregation for the Header checkbox.

aggregations.name: actionButtons
aggregations.description: A list of custom action buttons. These buttons are displayed in the button area for each node. A node may have up to 4 buttons. The default 3 buttons (collapse/expand, details, and links) have priority over any other custom buttons that you add. If you want all 4 of your custom buttons to be displayed, set the visibility of the default buttons to false.

aggregations.name: actionLinks
aggregations.description: A list of links to be shown in the links area. A link may point to any UI5 control. It's up to the caller to set up all necessary callback functions.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Custom content rendered with the node. Available only for rectangular nodes with HTML rendering type. When this aggregation is used, the description and attributes of sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.ElementBase are ignored.

aggregations.name: image
aggregations.description: The image that is displayed in the node's header instead of the icon.

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new Node.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: getActionButtons
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation actionButtons.

A list of custom action buttons. These buttons are displayed in the button area for each node. A node may have up to 4 buttons. The default 3 buttons (collapse/expand, details, and links) have priority over any other custom buttons that you add. If you want all 4 of your custom buttons to be displayed, set the visibility of the default buttons to false.

methods.name: getActionLinks
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation actionLinks.

A list of links to be shown in the links area. A link may point to any UI5 control. It's up to the caller to set up all necessary callback functions.

methods.name: getCenterPosition

returnValue.description: Object with X and Y coordinates of the center of the node. For circular nodes, this method returns the center of the circle.

methods.description: Returns center position of the node.

returnValue.description: Array of lines connecting this node with its child nodes

methods.description: Returns all lines connected to the child nodes.

returnValue.description: Array with child nodes

methods.description: Returns all child nodes.

methods.name: getCollapsed

returnValue.description: Value of property collapsed

methods.description:
Gets current value of property collapsed.

Defines if the subtree of this node is collapsed. By default, it is expanded.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getContent
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation content.

Custom content rendered with the node. Available only for rectangular nodes with HTML rendering type. When this aggregation is used, the description and attributes of sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.ElementBase are ignored.

methods.name: getCoreNodeSize

returnValue.description: Value of property coreNodeSize

methods.description:
Gets current value of property coreNodeSize.

Determines the size of a custom node, which can be useful for nodes that have text or other content outside of its shape.
This property is available for custom nodes only.

Default value is 0.

methods.name: getDescriptionLineSize

returnValue.description: Value of property descriptionLineSize

methods.description:
Gets current value of property descriptionLineSize.

Determines the maximum number of lines allowed to be displayed in the node's description. If you want to hide the description, set this property to -1 (default). To display an unlimited number of lines, set this property to 0. This property does not affect the description that appears in the tooltip, which is always fully rendered.

Default value is -1.

methods.name: getEnabledActionButtons

returnValue.description: Returns an array of enabled action buttons.

methods.description: Gets the node's action buttons that are enabled.

methods.name: getGroup

Gets current value of property group.

Key of the group where this node is included.

methods.name: getHeaderCheckbox
methods.description: Returns header checkbox object

methods.name: getHeaderCheckBoxState

returnValue.description: Value of property headerCheckBoxState

methods.description:
Gets current value of property headerCheckBoxState.

Defines if the Header checkbox should be displayed and whether it should be selected or not. By default, the checkbox is hidden. Available only for box nodes.

Default value is Hidden.

methods.name: getHeight

returnValue.description: Value of property height

methods.description:
Gets current value of property height.

Height of the node. In circular nodes, it determines the circle diameter.

Default value is undefined.

methods.name: getIcon

returnValue.description: Value of property icon

methods.description:
Gets current value of property icon.

An icon associated with the element.

methods.name: getIconSize

returnValue.description: Value of property iconSize

methods.description:
Gets current value of property iconSize.

Determines the size of the node's icon. This property can be applied only to circular nodes.

Default value is undefined.

methods.name: getImage
methods.description:

The image that is displayed in the node's header instead of the icon.

methods.name: getKey

returnValue.description: Value of property key

methods.description:

Key of the node. This key is used throughout the DOM to reference this node, mainly in the connector line (Line) elements of the graph.

methods.name: getMaxWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property maxWidth

methods.description:
Gets current value of property maxWidth.

Maximum width allowed. The auto grow algorithm stops increasing the width at this value.

Default value is undefined.

Determines the maximum number of lines allowed for the node's label. If set to 0, the label may have an unlimited number of lines.

Default value is 1.

methods.name: getVisible

returnValue.description: Value of property visible

methods.description:
Gets current value of property visible.

Whether the control should be visible on the screen. Node is still used for layouter.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property width

methods.description:
Gets current value of property width.

Width of the node. If the width is not defined, the node expands, so it can fit the content.

Default value is undefined.

methods.name: getX

returnValue.description: Value of property x

methods.description:
Gets current value of property x.

The x coordinate of the node. This value must be set after the layout algorithm has finished arranging the graph. It may come from the input data but is not required for most layout algorithms.
Works only for CustomLayout or NoopLayout layout algorithms. Other layout algorithms override this property. However, you can still change it using an afterLayouting event.

Default value is 0.

methods.name: getY

Gets current value of property y.

The y coordinate of the node. This value must be set after the layout algorithm has finished arranging the graph. It may come from the input data but is not required for most layout algorithms.
Works only for CustomLayout or NoopLayout layout algorithms. Other layout algorithms override this property. However, you can still change it using an afterLayouting event.

Default value is 0.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.Status
symbols.description:
The status element holds information about a custom status that can be applied to nodes, lines, and groups of nodes.

You can create multiple custom statuses and assign them to your graph using the statuses aggregation of the sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.Graph control.

Alternatively, you can use default statuses provided by the sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.ElementStatus element.

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description:
Fill color.
The fill color that is applied to elements and lines that are in this custom status.

properties.name: borderColor
properties.description:
Border color.
The border color that is applied to elements in this custom status.

properties.name: borderStyle
properties.description: Style of the border. For sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.Line elements use this value as parameter for stroke-dasharray.

properties.name: borderWidth
properties.description: Border width of the element in specific units (for example 2px).

properties.name: contentColor
properties.description:
Color of the content (text or icon) inside the node.
The color is applied to a node's content when it enters this custom status.

properties.name: headerContentColor
properties.description:
Color of the header content (title and icon) of the node.
Applicable only to the rectangular nodes.

properties.name: hoverBackgroundColor
properties.description:
Fill color on hover.
The fill color of a custom status element, line, or group when you hover over it.

properties.name: hoverBorderColor
properties.description:
Border color on hover.
The border color of a custom status element when you hover over it.

properties.name: hoverContentColor
properties.description: Content color on hover. Color of the content (text or icon) inside the custom status element when you hover over it.

properties.name: legendColor
properties.description:
Color displayed in the graph's legend.
If not set, the fill color defined in the backgroundColor property is used.

properties.name: selectedBackgroundColor
properties.description:
Fill color when selected.
The fill color of a custom status element when you select it.

properties.name: selectedBorderColor
properties.description: Border color when selected. The border color of a custom status element when you select it.

properties.name: selectedContentColor
properties.description: Content color when selected. Color of the content (text or icon) inside the custom status node when you select it.

properties.name: title
properties.description:
Title of the node.
The title that is applied to elements that are in this custom status. The title is displayed in the legend.

properties.name: useFocusColorAsContentColor
properties.description:
Defines whether the focus border should match the color of the content in focus. If false, the focus border has the default color.
This property can be used only for nodes and groups of nodes.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.util.Dijkstra
symbols.description: This algorithm uses Dijkstra's algorithm to compute the shortest possible paths from the starting point node to all other nodes in the graph and arrange them accordingly.

parameters.name: oGraph
parameters.description: Graph to compute the paths in.

parameters.name: oSourceNode
parameters.description: Node that serves as the starting point for computing the paths.

parameters.name: oSettings
parameters.description: Settings for the algorithm.

parameters.name: fnLineValue
parameters.description: Evaluation function for determining the value of a line. The function will receive the line to be evaluated as a parameter and must return a positive number representing its value (note that Dijkstra's algorithm cannot be used on negative values of lines). If this function is not passed as a parameter, the algorithm will consider the value of each line to be 1.

parameters.name: bIgnoreDirections
parameters.description: Makes the algorithm ignore line directions and treat the graph as non-oriented.

parameters.name: bIgnoreCollapsed
parameters.description: Makes the algorithm ignore collapsed and hidden nodes.

constructor.description: Constructor for a new Dijkstra's algorithm. The constructor computes the shortest paths to all nodes in the network graph from given starting point node.

methods.name: getShortestPathTo

returnValue.description: Lines representing the shortest path.

parameters.name: oToNode
parameters.description: Node to find shortest path to.

methods.description: Retrieves the shortest path to the given node. Due to the nature of the algorithm, the path is returned in reversed order. In most cases, each line has to be processed anyway, so the order is not important. However, if you need to retrieve lines in the direct order, you can use the Array.reverse() method.

symbols.title: class sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.util.Dijkstra

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.NoteTaker
symbols.description: This control allows you to create and store your notes for further reference.

properties.name: attachmentName
properties.description: The attachment property name for identification on the server side after sending data to the server.

properties.name: attachmentUploadUrl
properties.description: Defines a path on the server where the attached files are uploaded.

properties.name: cardViewAllTrigger
properties.description: The View All link appears in the Note Taker card when length of a card body text exceeds the specified value. The updated value of this property is not applied to the existing cards.

properties.name: filterCriteria
properties.description: A composite object containing criteria for filtering cards in the Note Taker.

properties.name: visibleNotes
properties.description: Number of notes to display.

aggregations.name: cards
aggregations.description: This aggregation allows you to add note cards to the Note Taker and remove them from the Note Taker.

aggregations.description: A slideable container for the NoteTaker cards and Feeder card.

symbols.title: class sap.suite.ui.commons.NoteTakerCard
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.32
symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.32. Deprecated. Standard Fiori technology should be used.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.NoteTakerFeeder
symbols.description: This control allows you to enter a quick note and N note cards.

properties.name: attachmentName
properties.description: The attachment property name for identification on the server side after sending data to the server.

properties.name: attachmentUploadUrl
properties.description: Sets the upload attachment URL for a new card.

properties.name: body
properties.description: The text inside the note card.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: The list of tags selected for addition to a new note card.

properties.name: thumbDown
properties.description: Sets negative indication for a new note.

properties.name: thumbUp
properties.description: Sets positive indication for a new note.

properties.name: title
properties.description: This text is the header of a new note.

aggregations.name: bodyArea
aggregations.description: Hidden aggregation of body area control.

aggregations.name: fileUploader
aggregations.description: Hidden aggregation of FileUploader control.

aggregations.name: tagInput
aggregations.description: Hidden aggregation of tag field control.

aggregations.name: titleInput
aggregations.description: Hidden aggregation of title field control.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new NoteTakerFeeder.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: addNote

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the note to be added.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The text of the note to be added.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: The timestamp of the note to be added.

parameters.name: thumbUp
parameters.description: If set to true, a new card should be marked as positive one.

parameters.description: If set to true, a new card should be marked as negative one.

parameters.description: Stores the attachment file name for a new card.

events.name: attachmentUploadComplete

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The response message that comes from the server. On the server side this response has to be put within the "body" tags of the response document of the iFrame. It can consist of a return code and an optional message. This does not work in cross-domain scenarios.

events.description: The event is fired when the upload of the file is completed. However this covers only the client side of the Upload process and does not give any success status from the server.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlow
symbols.description: Complex control that enables you to display documents or other items in their flow.

properties.name: foldedCorners
properties.description: This property defines the folded corners for the single node control. The following values exist: - true: means folded corner - false/null/undefined: means normal corner

properties.name: scrollable
properties.description:
By default, the control body is embedded into a scroll container of fixed size, so the user can put the control into a fixed size layout. When the control body (the graph) gets larger, the container cuts the overflowing parts of the graph and the cut parts can be displayed by scrolling the control body. When the control body fits into the container limits, obviously no scrolling is possible (and makes sense).

The scrolling feature can be turned off by setting this property value to false, so the width/height of the whole control will change as the flow graph gets smaller/larger. In this case the control body could not be scrolled, as the control body size matches the control container size.

properties.name: showLabels
properties.description: Defines if the connection labels are shown or not.

properties.name: wheelZoomable
properties.description: Defines if semantic zooming by mouse wheel events on desktop browsers is enabled.
