symbols.title: class sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlow

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowConnection
symbols.description: This control is used inside the ProcessFlow control to connect process flow node A with process flow node B in respect to the style(x) chosen by the application.

properties.name: drawData
properties.description: This is an array of the following attributes for one element: 1. flowLine (string) - A connection definition where the line should be drawn. A string which defines a course of a flow line. A flow line is a connection between nodes in a process flow control. The string can contain the following characters: - "r" for right, - "t" for top, - "l" for left, - "b" for bottom. 2. targetNodeState (ProcessFlowNodeState) - A copy of the target node status. If the target node is created, the line is solid. If the target node is planned, the line is dashed. 3. displayState (ProcessFlowDisplayState) - Display state of the node. This property defines if the node is displayed regularly, highlighted, or dimmed in combination with a selected visual style of the control. 4. hasArrow (boolean) - Indicates if the line has an arrow on the right end.

properties.name: state
properties.description: State of the connection.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.32. State is deprecated because of no usages. There will be no replacement.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the connection.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.32. Type is deprecated because of no usages. There will be no replacement.

properties.name: zoomLevel
properties.description: This is a current zoom level for the connection. The point of connection to the node is derived from zoom level.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowConnectionLabel
symbols.description: This control is used inside the ProcessFlow control providing information on connections. Using this control, you need to take care of the lifetime handling instance as instances of this control are not destroyed automatically.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: Priority is used to define which label is visible if the state of multiple labels is equal. Assuming there are multiple labels with equal state (e.g. Negative state appears twice), the priority decides which one needs to be selected.

properties.name: state
properties.description: Specifies the state of the connection label. If multiple labels are available for one connection, the label will be selected by state based on the following order: Neutral -> Positive -> Critical -> Negative.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowLaneHeader
symbols.description: This control gives you an overview of documents or items used in a process flow. The process flow is represented by donut chart sections that are colored according to the status of documents. This control can be used in two different ways. If you use it standalone, an event is triggered and can be caught to display the node map. If you use it with nodes or documents, it gives you an overview of the documents or items used in the process flow, which is represented by the donut chart sections.

properties.name: iconSrc
properties.description: Icon to be displayed in the middle of the control.

properties.name: laneId
properties.description: Internal identification of the header.

properties.name: position
properties.description: Position of the lane in the process flow control. Numbering of the position has to be sequential and needs to start from 0.

properties.name: state
properties.description: Array of the ProcessFlowLaneState. The user can explicitly set an array with the two properties state and value of the state, for example [state:sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowNodeState.Neutral, value: 20]. Possible states are states are positive, negative, neutral, and planned.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Text information that is displayed in the control.

properties.name: zoomLevel
properties.description: Current zoom level for the lane header.

symbols.title: class sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowLaneHeader

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowLaneState
symbols.description: This type is used in the 'state' property of the ProcessFlowLaneHeader. For example, app developers can set the status of the lane header if lanes are displayed without documents. If the complete process flow is displayed (that is, if the lane header is displayed with documents underneath), the given state values of the lane header are ignored and will be calculated in the ProcessFlow according to the current state of the documents.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowLaneState.state
properties.description: The 'state' property is associated with the given value. Possible states are: positive, negative, neutral, and planned.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowLaneState.value
properties.description: In the 'state' array, the total amount of values needs to be 100%.

symbols.title: enum sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowLaneState

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowNode
symbols.description: This control enables you to see documents (or other items) in respect to their statuses â€“ positive, negative, neutral, planned, planned negative. In addition to the node title (which can be optionally a hyperlink) also two other text fields are provided and can be filled. The process flow nodes consider all styles depending on the status they are in. The user can update or change the content of the node. The content of the node can be also filtered according to updated data and specific parameters set. This means that also the nodeâ€™s style is affected.

properties.name: children
properties.description: Defines an array of children of the node.

properties.name: focused
properties.description: The parameter defines if the node should be displayed in focus state.

properties.name: highlighted
properties.description: The parameter defines if the node should be displayed in highlighted state.

properties.name: isTitleClickable
properties.description: Specifies if the node title is clickable.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.26. According to the new requirement there should be only one click event for each node (click on the whole node â€“ see Press event) that is why titlePress event should not be used any longer. Hence isTitleClickable should not be used either.

properties.name: laneId
properties.description: Specifies the assignment of the node to the respective lane.

properties.name: nodeId
properties.description: Node identifier.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: The parameter defines if the node should be displayed in selected state.

properties.name: state
properties.description: State of the node.

properties.name: stateText
properties.description: Description of the state, for example "Status OK".

properties.name: tag
properties.description: The user-defined object which is returned back to the user by a node click event.

properties.name: texts
properties.description: The property contains the additional texts on the node. The expected type is array of strings. One array must not contain more than two strings. Additional strings in the array will be ignored.

properties.name: title
properties.description: The node title.

properties.name: titleAbbreviation
properties.description: Title abbreviation is used in zoom level 'Three'.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the node.

aggregations.name: ariaProperties
aggregations.description: ARIA-compliant properties to be added to the control.

aggregations.name: zoomLevelFourContent
aggregations.description: The node's content used for zoom level 4. If this aggregation is set, no default content like title and texts is used.

aggregations.name: zoomLevelOneContent
aggregations.description: The node's content used for zoom level 1. If this aggregation is set, no default content like title and texts is used.

aggregations.name: zoomLevelThreeContent
aggregations.description: The node's content used for zoom level 3. If this aggregation is set, no default content like title and texts is used.

aggregations.name: zoomLevelTwoContent
aggregations.description: The node's content used for zoom level 2. If this aggregation is set, no default content like title and texts is used.

associations.name: parents
associations.description: Reference to ProcessFlowNodes which appears before this ProcessFlowNode.

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the press event of this sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowNode.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowNode itself.

This event is fired when the user clicks on the node. However, this event is not fired if the titlePress event has been fired.

symbols.title: class sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowNode

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowNodeState
symbols.description: Describes the state connected to the content it is representing in the Process Flow Node. The state is also displayed in the Process Flow Lane Header as a color segment of the donut.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowNodeState.Critical
properties.description: Critical status for a created document: with this document, a critical issue occurred, for example, the business process can be interrupted.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowNodeState.Negative
properties.description: Negative status for a created document: with this document, an issue occurred.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowNodeState.Neutral
properties.description: Neutral status for a created document: the document is in progress.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowNodeState.Planned
properties.description: Planned status for a document: the document is planned to be started.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowNodeState.PlannedNegative
properties.description: Planned, but negative status for a document: the planned document has an issue but has not yet been started.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowNodeState.Positive
properties.description: Positive status for a created document: the document is done, finished, solved.

symbols.title: enum sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowNodeState

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowNodeType
symbols.description: Describes the type of a node. The type value could be single or aggregated. With this type, the application can define if several nodes should be displayed as one aggregated node in a path per column to represent a grouping of semantically equal nodes.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowNodeType.Aggregated
properties.description: Aggregated node - several nodes are illustrated as a stack of nodes in the same path and in one column.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowNodeType.Single
properties.description: Single node - one node is illustrated in a column.

symbols.title: enum sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowNodeType

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowZoomLevel
symbols.description: The zoom level defines level of details for the node and how much space the process flow requires.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowZoomLevel.Four
properties.description: Zoom level for least details - only icon is displayed.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowZoomLevel.One
properties.description: The full details with normal font size.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowZoomLevel.Three
properties.description: The details are the icon, title text and no additional texts.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowZoomLevel.Two
properties.description: The full detail view of the node but with smaller font size.

symbols.title: enum sap.suite.ui.commons.ProcessFlowZoomLevel

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.RepeaterViewConfiguration
symbols.description: A configuration control defining how the content of the sap.suite.ui.commons.ViewRepeater control is displayed and what data is bound.

properties.name: external
properties.description: Indicates if the external representation of this view is rendered instead of the row repeater's own content.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: A path to the icon representing this view in sap.suite.ui.commons.ViewRepeater view selector.

properties.name: iconHovered
properties.description: A path to the icon representing this view in sap.suite.ui.commons.ViewRepeater view selector when the regular icon is hovered.

properties.name: iconSelected
properties.description: A path to the icon representing this view in sap.suite.ui.commons.ViewRepeater view selector when the regular icon is selected.

properties.name: itemHeight
properties.description: The height of the tile in this view in pixels. Only applicable if the responsive property is set to true. This value is used for calculating the number of tile rows.

properties.name: itemMinWidth
properties.description: The minimal width of the tile in this view. Only applicable if "responsive" property is set to true.

properties.name: numberOfTiles
properties.description: The number of tiles/rows that will be shown on a single page in this view.

properties.name: path
properties.description: A path used for rows/titles data binding.

properties.name: responsive
properties.description: This parameter indicates whether the content is shown in rows or tiles. If false, the content is shown in rows just like in core sap.ui.commons.RowRepeater. If true, the content is shown in tiles (similar to sap.ui.ux3.DataSet control) that have minimal width defined by the "itemMinWidth" property. The number of columns depends on the parent control's width. If you resize the control, the number of columns may change respectively so that the content tiles can fill the entire space of a row.

properties.name: title
properties.description: The title of the view to be displayed in sap.suite.ui.commons.ViewRepeater view selector. If neither this nor "icon" property are defined, the default title "View ##" will be shown, where ## is an index number of the view in View Repeater starting from 1.

aggregations.name: externalRepresentation
aggregations.description: The control to be rendered instead of sap.suite.ui.commons.ViewRepeater's own content. Only used if the "external" property is set to true. This allows you to create custom views, for example, Table views. The sap.suite.ui.commons.ViewRepeater control will share its model with this control if the control does not have its own model.

aggregations.name: template
aggregations.description: The control used as a template while displaying rows/tiles in this view. It should not have fixed width wider than defined by the "itemMinWidth" property, otherwise some content may appear cropped.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new RepeaterViewConfiguration.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oResponsive
parameters.description: New value for property responsive

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property responsive.

This parameter indicates whether the content is shown in rows or tiles. If false, the content is shown in rows just like in core sap.ui.commons.RowRepeater. If true, the content is shown in tiles (similar to sap.ui.ux3.DataSet control) that have minimal width defined by the "itemMinWidth" property. The number of columns depends on the parent control's width. If you resize the control, the number of columns may change respectively so that the content tiles can fill the entire space of a row.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.SplitButton
symbols.description: The Split Button Control is a composite control that consists of a default-action Button and a Menu Button control. The default-action button control represents a simple push button. It is used for initiating actions, such as save or print. It can contain some text, an icon, or both; the order of the two can be configured. The action initiated by this button is considered to be the default action for the control, and it must be one of the selections defined in the Menu Button menu. The Menu Button control is a button that opens a menu upon user's click. MenuButton is a composition of the Menu control and the Button control and thus inheriting all features. When a menu item is selected by the user, MenuButton throws an event called itemSelected. The event transfers the itemId of the selected item. As an alternative, the button press event can be used which has a similar behavior.

properties.description: Boolean property to enable the control (default is true). Buttons that are disabled have other colors than enabled ones, depending on custom settings.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.statusindicator.CustomShape
symbols.description: Custom shape that is defined directly as SVG.

properties.name: definition
properties.description:
A valid XML fragment that contains an <svg> element that complies with the following requirements:

  • It includes no SVG groups (<g> elements).
  • It includes no <defs> elements.
The SVG element is transformed into a status indicator shape in the following way:
  • The viewBox attribute of the root SVG element is respected and kept after the transformation.
  • The inline styles of SVG shapes are respected, and shapes with such inline styles are not considered to be fillable.
  • The SVG shapes without classes are considered fillable.
  • If there are multiple fillable shapes, each shape element must have a data-shape-id attribute that is set to a unique value.
Example: 
  <svg version="1.1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 30 30" xml:space="preserve">
     <path style="fill:blue;" d="M14.664,29...." />
     <path style="fill:blue;" d="M13.626,25...." />
     <path data-shape-id="fill-1" d="M15.337,21...." />
     <path data-shape-id="fill-2" d="M13.626,17...." />
     <path data-shape-id="fill-3" d="M15.337,14...." />
     <path data-shape-id="fill-4" d="M13.107,10...." />
  </svg>
The first two paths in this example are filled with blue color. The last four shape elements are filled gradually, as the status indicator's value changes.

Please note that the SVG element must be escaped when used directly as an attribute in the XML view.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Defines the height of the bounding rectangle.

properties.name: strokeColor
properties.description: Specifies the color of the shape's outline.

properties.name: strokeWidth
properties.description: Specifies the width of the shape's outline.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the bounding rectangle.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Defines the x coordinate of the upper-left corner of the bounding rectangle.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Defines the y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the bounding rectangle.

aggregations.name: fillingOptions
aggregations.description: Defines the order and weight of fillable shapes based on the status indicator value distribution. If this aggregation is not used, the shapes are filled in the order they are specified in the SVG definition.

aggregations.name: shapes
aggregations.description: Read-only aggregation that contains simple shapes transformed from the SVG definition.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.statusindicator.FillingOption
symbols.description: Filling options for an SVG shape included in a custom shape.

properties.name: order
properties.description: Order in which this fillable SVG shape must be filled, relative to other SVG shapes included in the custom shape. For example, if you have three SVG shapes with order values 1, 2, and 4 assigned, the first shape will be filled first, then the second shape, and, finally, the third shape, regardless of their order in the SVG definition. The value of this property must be unique.

properties.name: shapeId
properties.description: ID of the fillable SVG shape included in a custom shape.

properties.name: weight
properties.description:
Weight of the fillable shape, relative to other fillable shapes included in this custom shape. This property allows you to distribute the status indicator's value between distinct SVG shapes included in the custom shape. For example, for four SVG shapes with weights 1, 2, 3, and 4 (total weight 10), the status indicator's value is distributed in the following way:

  • If the status indicator's value is below 10% (1 out of 10), the first SVG shape (weight 1) is partially filled, depending on the percentage value. For example, if the percentage value of the status indicator is 5, the first SVG shape appears half-full. The rest of the SVG shapes appear empty.
  • If the status indicator's value is at least 10% but below 30%, the first SVG shape (weight 1) is filled, and the second shape (weight 2) is filled only partially, depending on the percentage value. The rest of the SVG shapes in this custom shape appear empty.
  • If the status indicator's value is at least 30% but below 60%, the first two SVG shapes (weight 1 and 2) are filled, and the third SVG shape (weight 3) is filled only partially. The fourth SVG shape (weight 4) appears empty.
  • If the status indicator's value is at least 60% but below 100%, the first three SVG shapes (weight 1, 2, and 3) are filled, but the fourth SVG shape is filled only partially, depending on the percentage value.
  • If the status indicator's value is 100, all four SVG shapes appear filled.

parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.statusindicator.Shape
symbols.description: Abstract shape that displays the value of the status indicator. The shape reflects the status indicator's percentage value by filling one or more of its parts (SVG shapes) with the specified color.

properties.name: animationOnChange
properties.description:
Defines if the change in the status indicator value should be animated or not.
When set to true, the change in value is animated.

properties.name: animationOnStartup
properties.description: Defines if the initial value of the status indicator should be animated or directly displayed on startup. By default, it's displayed on startup without any animation.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.54.1. Use the animationOnChange property instead.

properties.name: animationOnStartupDelay
properties.description: Specifies the delay of the initial value animation. Only applicable if the animationOnStartup property is set to true.

properties.name: fillColor
properties.description: Defines the color of the shape's fill.

properties.name: fillingAngle
properties.description:
Defines the angle at which the shape is filled. This property overrides the fillingDirection property.
Accepted values include 0 through 360 degrees.
For example, if you set the filling angle to 45, the shape will be filled diagonally from the lower right part of the shape to its upper left part.
This property can be used only when sap.suite.ui.commons.statusindicator.FillingType is set to Linear.

properties.name: fillingDirection
properties.description: Defines the direction in which the shape is filled.

properties.name: fillingType
properties.description: Defines the type of the shape's fill.

properties.name: fullAnimationDuration
properties.description: Specifies the duration, in milliseconds, of the animation that would fill an empty shape to the full. The actual time it takes to change the shape's filling is proportional to the difference between the initial and the target status indicator's value. For example, a change from 20 percent to 70 percent takes only half of the time specified in the fullAnimationDuration property. If this property is set to 0, changes are applied instantly without any animation.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.54.1. All animations are now limited to 250 ms.

properties.name: horizontalAlignment
properties.description: Defines the horizontal alignment of the shape within its parent container.

properties.name: verticalAlignment
properties.description: Defines the vertical alignment of the shape within its parent container.

symbols.title: class sap.suite.ui.commons.statusindicator.Shape

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.statusindicator.ShapeGroup
symbols.description: Group of shapes that display status indicator value. Shapes in the group are filled in parallel, actual animation might depend on particular shape setting.

properties.name: weight
properties.description:
Weight of the group, relative to other groups in the status indicator. This property allows you to distribute the status indicator's value between groups of shapes that it contains. For example, for three groups with weights 10, 10, and 20 (total weight 40), the status indicator's value is distributed in the following way:

  • If the status indicator's value is below 25% (10 out of 40), the first group of shapes (weight 10) is partially filled, depending on the percentage value. For example, if the percentage value is 5, the first group of shapes is 1/5-full. The second and the third groups are empty.
  • If the status indicator's value is at least 25% but below 50%, the first group of shapes (weight 10) is filled, the second group (also weight 10) is partially filled, and the third group (weight 20) appears empty.
  • If the status indicator's value is at least 50% but below 100%, the first two groups of shapes (weight 10 each) are filled, but the third group (weight 20) is only partially filled.
  • If the status indicator's value is 100, all three groups of shapes are filled.

aggregations.name: shapes
aggregations.description: List of shapes that belong to this group.

parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

  • If the status indicator's value is at least 25% but below 50%, the first group of shapes (weight 10) is filled, the second group (also weight 10) is partially filled, and the third group (weight 20) appears empty.

symbols.title: enum sap.suite.ui.commons.statusindicator.SizeType

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.statusindicator.StatusIndicator
symbols.description:
The status indicator control displays a value between 0 and 100.

A status indicator may consist of multiple groups that gradually display the value. The shapes in the first group are filled first, the shapes in the second group second, and so on.

The value of the status indicator is distributed between the groups depending on their weight.

The filling of the shapes in the groups can be proportional to the value of the status indicator or can be based on thresholds specified in the discreteThresholds aggregation.

properties.name: ariaLabel
properties.description: ARIA label for this control to be used by screen reader software.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the status indicator. Only sets the height of the image part of the status indicator, potential label is not included.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Predefined sizes for the status indicator.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Percentage value, between 0 and 100, that the status indicator reflects.

properties.name: viewBox
properties.description: Defines the view box surrounding the shapes included in the status indicator.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the status indicator. Only sets the width of the image part of the status indicator, potential label is not included. The root div of the status indicator is set as display: "block" and so takes up the whole space available. Wrap status indicator in sap.m.FlexBox control if you wish to control width of the whole status indicator.

aggregations.name: discreteThresholds
aggregations.description:
Specifies discrete thresholds for the status indicator. If discrete thresholds are set, the status indicator adjusts its appearance to the closest threshold value that is not greater than the actual percentage value of the status indicator. For example, if the following discrete thresholds are specified:

  • value = "20"
  • value = "60"
  • value = "100"
The status indicator displays the following percentage values:
  • 0 if the actual value is 15
  • 20 if the actual value is 20
  • 20 if the actual value is 55
  • 60 if the actual value is 60
  • 60 if the actual value is 79
  • 100 if the actual value is 100
Please note that these thresholds affect only the appearance of the status inicator, not its stored value.

aggregations.name: groups
aggregations.description: Groups of shapes that display the status indicator's percentage value. A status indicator must always include at least one group.

aggregations.name: propertyThresholds
aggregations.description: Defines how shapes are filled based on the status indicator's percentage value.

associations.name: ariaDescribedBy
associations.description: Controls or IDs that provide a description for this control. Can be used by screen reader software.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Controls or IDs that label this control. Can be used by screen reader software.

methods.name: getDiscreteThresholds
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation discreteThresholds.

Specifies discrete thresholds for the status indicator. If discrete thresholds are set, the status indicator adjusts its appearance to the closest threshold value that is not greater than the actual percentage value of the status indicator. For example, if the following discrete thresholds are specified:

  • value = "20"
  • value = "60"
  • value = "100"
The status indicator displays the following percentage values:
  • 0 if the actual value is 15
  • 20 if the actual value is 20
  • 20 if the actual value is 55
  • 60 if the actual value is 60
  • 60 if the actual value is 79
  • 100 if the actual value is 100
Please note that these thresholds affect only the appearance of the status inicator, not its stored value.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.taccount.TAccount
symbols.description: The T account control displays debit and credit entries on a general ledger account. It can be used to visualize the flow of transactions through the accounts where these transactions are stored.

properties.name: collapsed
properties.description:
Defines whether the T account should appear as collapsed.
By default, it appears as expanded.

properties.name: measureOfUnit
properties.description:
Unit of measurement. Can be set to a currency or any other applicable unit of measurement.
Please note that if multi-currency accounts are used, the T account control will not convert the values to the currency defined in this property.

properties.description: Mode with opening and closing balance of the T account.

properties.description: Opening credit balance of the T account.

symbols.description:
A panel that acts as a container for sap.suite.ui.commons.TAccountGroup controls included in it.
The settings dialog of the panel can be used to modify how the sap.suite.ui.commons.TAccountItem elements in the included T accounts are displayed.

properties.name: showOverlay
properties.description:
Indicates whether the T account panel should be covered by a translucent overlay screen.
This overlay screen can be used to hide the data temporarily.

properties.description:
State of the panel that defines how T accounts are displayed.
By default, the T accounts included in the panel are displayed as T shapes with debit and credit entries on either side of the T.

methods.name: getSum

returnValue.description: Object that includes the sum of entries in all included T-account groups.

methods.description:
Gets the sum of transactions in all T-account groups included in the panel.

Returns a sum object that is structured as follows:
{
measure: {string} Unit of measurement of the T accounts. If T accounts use different units of measurements, the last one is returned.
sum: {number} Sum of all entries in the T accounts and T-account groups included in the panel.
correct: {boolean} If false, the sum cannot be calculated, because the T accounts use different units of measurement.
}

properties.description: The name of the entity set from OData service metadata. The filtering applies to this entity set.

aggregations.description: The hidden aggregation for the internal control that displays the number of entries in the filtered set.

aggregations.name: _quad0
aggregations.description: The hidden aggregation for the internal control that represents the right top quadrant.

aggregations.name: _quad1
aggregations.description: The hidden aggregation for the internal control that represents the left top quadrant.

aggregations.name: _quad2
aggregations.description: The hidden aggregation for the internal control that represents the left bottom quadrant.

aggregations.name: _quad3
aggregations.description: The hidden aggregation for the internal control that represents the right bottom quadrant.

symbols.description: The configuration element for the column in the TargetFilter control.

properties.name: length
properties.description: The number of the retrieved entries for the cloud of the links in the quadrant. The quadrant can display fewer links than retrieved. The font size of the links in the quadrant depends on the measure number. The font size of the links is relative in the retrieved group.

properties.name: path
properties.description: The binding path.

properties.name: title
properties.description: The column title.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the displayed data. The type of the property must be sap.ui.model.SimpleType or its descendants. By default, sap.ui.model.type.String. This property is used for formatting the displayed values. If sap.ui.model.type.String, the filter operator in the Search field of the column selection dialog is 'Contains'. In other cases, the filter operator is 'EQ'.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ThreePanelThingViewer
symbols.description: This control extends the sap.ui.ux3.ThingViewer control. The first panel can display a thing icon, a title, the Action Menu button, up to two rows of text descriptions (the first is wrapped, the second is truncated), vertical navigation bar (sap.suite.ui.commons.VerticalNavigationBar), and an image aka key visual. The second panel displays the header area as a vertical panel containing ThingGroup objects. The third panel is a main content area designed to display ThingGroup objects.

properties.name: logo
properties.description: A URL of the source of an image known as key visual. This can be a company logo or other essential graphics.

properties.name: showHeader
properties.description: Shows or hides a middle panel named Header that contains general information.

properties.name: sidebarWidth
properties.description: The width of the first panel that contains thing's title, icon, key visual and navigation bar. The default value is "244px".

aggregations.name: menuContent
aggregations.description: This aggregation allows you to add sap.ui.commons.Link items to the Action Menu. The menu appears as a popup when a user chooses a button in the top title section of the navigation panel.

parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.Timeline
symbols.description:
The timeline control shows entries (such as objects, events, or posts) in chronological order.
A common use case is to provide information about changes to an object, or events related to an object. These entries can be generated by the system (for example, value XY changed from A to B), or added manually.
There are two distinct variants of the timeline: basic and social. The basic timeline is read-only, while the social timeline offers a high level of interaction and collaboration, and is integrated within SAP Jam.

properties.name: alignment
properties.description: Defines the alignment of timeline posts relative to the timeline axis. This option can be used for single-sided timelines only. If the axisOrientation property is set to Horizontal, the Right value is interpreted as bottom alignment and the Left value as top alignment.

properties.name: axisOrientation
properties.description: Defines the orientation of the timeline. Can be set to Vertical or Horizontal.

properties.name: data
properties.description: Data for the Timeline control.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.46.0. As of version 1.46, this property was replaced by JSONModel context binding.

properties.name: dateTimePath
properties.description: Path for dateTime in mode binding. Use this property when you use factory function for TimeLineItem creation. When every item has different path or the datetime is calculated in factory sorting, filtering and searching has to be done manually using events. If not set for factory binding filter and sorting won't work.

properties.name: enableAllInFilterItem
properties.description: Enables to add 'All' at the beginning of the filter list.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.46.0. The filter list now includes a Select All check box, so the All radio button is no longer required. This property is ignored.

properties.name: enableBackendFilter
properties.description: Enables fetching data from backend instead of deriving filter values from the frontend values (displayed list). As of version 1.46, replaced by sap.suite.ui.commons.Timeline#getEnableModelFilter.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.46.0. Use the enableModelFilter property instead.

properties.name: enableBusyIndicator
properties.description: When this property is set to true, the timeline displays a busy indicator when loading data. This busy indicator blocks the interaction with the items until the data loading is complete. It is strongly recommended to use this option. Loading data without a busy indicator may confuse the users.

properties.name: enableDoubleSided
properties.description: If set to true, timeline posts are displayed on both sides of the timeline axis.

properties.name: enableModelFilter
properties.description:
Enables filtering directly on the binding level. If set to true, all filters are translated into the filters in the model binding. When the OData model is used, the filtering is performed on the backend side. This option is strongly recommended. If set to false, all entries from the model need to be fetched before they can be filtered on the frontend side. Please be aware that the growingThreshold property determines how many entries can be rendered. Timeline requests all entries from the model before it performs the filtering. Some models may have internal limits for the number of entries that can be used in bindings. Such limits can be set using sap.ui.model.Model#setSizeLimit.

Since: 1.46.0.

properties.name: enableScroll
properties.description: If set to true, the Timeline control has its own scroll bar, with the scrolling taking place within the Timeline control itself. Scrolling is required if you want to enable the lazyLoading property.

properties.name: enableSocial
properties.description: Adds a Reply link to the posts on a social timeline that allows users to reply to posts. When a user adds a reply, an event is fired. This event should be handled by external code.

properties.name: filterTitle
properties.description: Title for the data filter. When a filter is applied, this title is displayed in the message strip along with the filter name.

properties.name: forceGrowing
properties.description: If set to true, the Show More button is displayed when the user scrolls along the timeline axis.

properties.name: group
properties.description: Groups the timeline posts by year. As of version 1.46, replaced by sap.suite.ui.commons.Timeline#getGroupByType.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.46.0. Use the groupByType property instead.

properties.name: groupBy
properties.description: Groups the timeline posts by a field. Only fields that contain date values are supported.

properties.name: groupByType
properties.description: Groups the timeline posts by a time period, including year, quarter, month, week, and day. If set to None, no grouping is applied. If you specify a custom grouping function using the sap.suite.ui.commons.Timeline#setCustomGrouping method, this function overrides the groupByType property settings.

properties.name: growing
properties.description: If set to true, the timeline displays a limited number of posts with a button to show more. The displayed posts limit can be set using the growingThreshold property. As of version 1.46, replaced by sap.suite.ui.commons.Timeline#getGrowingThreshold.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.46.0. Use the growingThreshold property instead, setting it to 0 to disable growing.

properties.name: growingThreshold
properties.description: Number of posts requested from the server at a time. Each time when the timeline needs to load more posts, it will request exactly this amount. The number of posts displayed in the timeline is increased by this number. If set to 0, all posts are fetched and displayed on the initial load.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
Sets the height of the Timeline.

Since: 1.46.0.

properties.name: lazyLoading
properties.description:
Enables the Lazy Loading feature that automatically loads more posts as the user scrolls along the timeline axis. This feature works only when the enableScroll property is set to true. See also sap.suite.ui.commons.Timeline#getEnableScroll.

Since: 1.46.0.

properties.name: noDataText
properties.description: This text is displayed when the control has no data. The default value is loaded from the component resource bundle.

properties.name: scrollingFadeout
properties.description:
If set to Area, the timeline fades into the visible area margin. If set to AreaWithButtons, the timeline fades into the visible area margin and scroll buttons are displayed. If set to None, the fading effect is not applied. This feature works only when the enableScroll property is set to true. See also sap.suite.ui.commons.Timeline#getEnableScroll.

Since: 1.46.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.54.0. Not Fiori.

properties.name: showFilterBar
properties.description:
Sets the visibility of the filter in the timeline toolbar.
As of version 1.46, replaced by sap.suite.ui.commons.Timeline#getShowHeaderBar.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.46.0. Use the showHeaderBar property instead.

properties.name: showHeaderBar
properties.description: Shows the timeline toolbar with search and filter options.

properties.name: showIcons
properties.description: Shows an icon on the timeline axis as an anchor for each entry node. If set to false, all icons are replaced by dots.

properties.name: showItemFilter
properties.description: Show item filter in filter area.

properties.name: showSearch
properties.description: Sets the search field visibility on the timeline toolbar.

properties.name: showSort
properties.description: Show sort icon in the header bar. For displaying this icon, sorting have to be allowed.

properties.name: showSuggestion
properties.description:
If set to true, a suggest event is fired when the user enters text into the search field. Changing the suggestionItems aggregation in the suggest event listener will display suggestions inside a popup. As of version 1.46, replaced by sap.collaboration.components.feed.Component.

Since: 1.26.1.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.46.0. Use the Group Feed Component instead.

properties.name: showTimeFilter
properties.description: Shows the time range filter in the filter menu.

properties.name: sort
properties.description: Indicates whether the data should be sorted. If set to false the data model's default sorting is applied.

properties.name: sortOldestFirst
properties.description: Whether the oldest item will be displayed first.

properties.name: textHeight
properties.description:
Height of the timeline posts. It can be set to either of the following types of values:

  • Automatic – If set to automatic, the optimal post height is calculated automatically to fit the timeline height specified by the height parameter. This option works only in horizontal timelines and only when the timeline height is defined. In vertical timelines, this setting is ignored.
  • Number – If set to a number, a corresponding number of text lines is displayed in every post.
  • Pixels – If set to a number followed by px, such as 50px, the closest number in lines is calculated and applied to the timeline posts, so that the post height corresponds to the specified number of pixels and the text lines are not cut off in the middle of a line.
  • Any other valid CSSSize value that is inserted into the text wrapper without being changed.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Sets the width of the Timeline.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: List of timeline posts.

aggregations.name: customFilter
aggregations.description: A custom filter to be used instead of the default item filter. This control must have an openBy or open function that is used by the timeline to open the control. If the control has both functions, openBy is used.

aggregations.name: filterList
aggregations.description: Custom filter criteria for the items filter.

aggregations.name: suggestionItems
aggregations.description:
Items for suggestions. As of version 1.46, replaced by sap.collaboration.components.feed.Component.
Deprecated as of version 1.46.0. Use the Group Feed Component instead.

deprecated.text: Use the Group Feed Component instead.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of filter that has changed, can be an item filter or a time range filter.

parameters.name: searchTerm
parameters.description: Search term entered into the search field.

parameters.name: selectedItem
parameters.description: The first criteria selected in the filter criteria list (required for backward compatibility).

parameters.name: selectedItems
parameters.description: An array with all selected filter criteria.

parameters.name: timeKeys
parameters.description: An object specifying the start date (from) and the end date (to) of the time range.

parameters.name: clear
parameters.description: Is set to true when this event is fired by clearing the filter.

events.description: This event is fired when filtering is applied to timeline posts or when a search term is entered into the search field. This event can be fired only if the enableModelFilter property is set to true.

events.name: grow
events.description: This event is fired when the "More" button is clicked.

events.name: itemFiltering

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: Timeline post that is currently being filtered.

parameters.name: reasons
parameters.description: Reasons why the post is being filtered. Empty if the post is not being filtered. There are three properties available in the object: Search, Time, and Data. You can call preventDefault to the event object to prevent the result.

parameters.name: dataKeys
parameters.description: Array with keys used for data filtering.

parameters.name: timeKeys
parameters.description: An object specifying the start date (from) and the end date (to) of the time range.

parameters.name: searchTerm
parameters.description: The text string that has been typed into the search field.

events.description: This event is fired for every timeline post when data filtering is being applied. It indicates whether this post is included in the filtering and why. Can be used only when the enableModelFilter property is set to false.

events.name: select

parameters.name: selectedItem
parameters.description: The timeline post that is selected.

parameters.name: userAction
parameters.description:
Indicates whether the selection was triggered by a user action or in any other way.
Set to true if the selection was triggered by a user action, for example, by clicking with a mouse or pressing the Enter key.
Set to false if the selection was triggered in a different way, for example, by shifting focus back from a Popover element or by pressing an arrow key.
For backward compatibility, the select event is fired whenever an item gets focus.

events.description: This event is fired when a timeline post is selected.

events.name: suggest

parameters.name: suggestValue
parameters.description: The text string that has been typed into the search field.

events.description:
This event is fired when the user enters text into the search field, in cases when the showSuggestion property is set to true. Changing the suggestionItems aggregation will show the suggestions inside a popup.

Since: 1.26.1.

deprecated.text: Replaced by {@link sap.collaboration.components.feed.Component}.

events.description:

Since: 1.26.1.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property alignment.

Defines the alignment of timeline posts relative to the timeline axis. This option can be used for single-sided timelines only. If the axisOrientation property is set to Horizontal, the Right value is interpreted as bottom alignment and the Left value as top alignment.

Default value is Right.

Path for dateTime in mode binding. Use this property when you use factory function for TimeLineItem creation. When every item has different path or the datetime is calculated in factory sorting, filtering and searching has to be done manually using events. If not set for factory binding filter and sorting won't work.

methods.name: getEnableBackendFilter

returnValue.description: Value of property enableBackendFilter

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableBackendFilter.

Enables fetching data from backend instead of deriving filter values from the frontend values (displayed list). As of version 1.46, replaced by sap.suite.ui.commons.Timeline#getEnableModelFilter.

Default value is true.

deprecated.text: Use the enableModelFilter property instead.

methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.46.0. Use the enableModelFilter property instead.

methods.name: getEnableBusyIndicator

returnValue.description: Value of property enableBusyIndicator

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableBusyIndicator.

When this property is set to true, the timeline displays a busy indicator when loading data. This busy indicator blocks the interaction with the items until the data loading is complete. It is strongly recommended to use this option. Loading data without a busy indicator may confuse the users.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableDoubleSided

returnValue.description: Value of property enableDoubleSided

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableDoubleSided.

If set to true, timeline posts are displayed on both sides of the timeline axis.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getEnableModelFilter

returnValue.description: Value of property enableModelFilter

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableModelFilter.

Enables filtering directly on the binding level. If set to true, all filters are translated into the filters in the model binding. When the OData model is used, the filtering is performed on the backend side. This option is strongly recommended. If set to false, all entries from the model need to be fetched before they can be filtered on the frontend side. Please be aware that the growingThreshold property determines how many entries can be rendered. Timeline requests all entries from the model before it performs the filtering. Some models may have internal limits for the number of entries that can be used in bindings. Such limits can be set using sap.ui.model.Model#setSizeLimit.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableScroll

returnValue.description: Value of property enableScroll

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableScroll.

If set to true, the Timeline control has its own scroll bar, with the scrolling taking place within the Timeline control itself. Scrolling is required if you want to enable the lazyLoading property.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableSocial

returnValue.description: Value of property enableSocial

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableSocial.

Adds a Reply link to the posts on a social timeline that allows users to reply to posts. When a user adds a reply, an event is fired. This event should be handled by external code.

Default value is false.

If set to true, the timeline displays a limited number of posts with a button to show more. The displayed posts limit can be set using the growingThreshold property. As of version 1.46, replaced by sap.suite.ui.commons.Timeline#getGrowingThreshold.

methods.name: getGrowingThreshold

returnValue.description: Value of property growingThreshold

methods.description:
Gets current value of property growingThreshold.

Number of posts requested from the server at a time. Each time when the timeline needs to load more posts, it will request exactly this amount. The number of posts displayed in the timeline is increased by this number. If set to 0, all posts are fetched and displayed on the initial load.

Default value is 5.

Gets current value of property textHeight.

Height of the timeline posts. It can be set to either of the following types of values:

  • Automatic – If set to automatic, the optimal post height is calculated automatically to fit the timeline height specified by the height parameter. This option works only in horizontal timelines and only when the timeline height is defined. In vertical timelines, this setting is ignored.
  • Number – If set to a number, a corresponding number of text lines is displayed in every post.
  • Pixels – If set to a number followed by px, such as 50px, the closest number in lines is calculated and applied to the timeline posts, so that the post height corresponds to the specified number of pixels and the text lines are not cut off in the middle of a line.
  • Any other valid CSSSize value that is inserted into the text wrapper without being changed.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property width

methods.description:
Gets current value of property width.

Sets the width of the Timeline.

Default value is 100%.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEnableBusyIndicator
parameters.description: New value for property enableBusyIndicator

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property enableBusyIndicator.

When this property is set to true, the timeline displays a busy indicator when loading data. This busy indicator blocks the interaction with the items until the data loading is complete. It is strongly recommended to use this option. Loading data without a busy indicator may confuse the users.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setEnableModelFilter

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEnableModelFilter
parameters.description: New value for property enableModelFilter

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property enableModelFilter.

Enables filtering directly on the binding level. If set to true, all filters are translated into the filters in the model binding. When the OData model is used, the filtering is performed on the backend side. This option is strongly recommended. If set to false, all entries from the model need to be fetched before they can be filtered on the frontend side. Please be aware that the growingThreshold property determines how many entries can be rendered. Timeline requests all entries from the model before it performs the filtering. Some models may have internal limits for the number of entries that can be used in bindings. Such limits can be set using sap.ui.model.Model#setSizeLimit.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

parameters.name: bEnableScroll
parameters.description: New value for property enableScroll

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property enableScroll.

If set to true, the Timeline control has its own scroll bar, with the scrolling taking place within the Timeline control itself. Scrolling is required if you want to enable the lazyLoading property.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

symbols.title: class sap.suite.ui.commons.Timeline

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.TimelineAlignment
symbols.description: The alignment of timeline posts relative to the timeline axis.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.TimelineAlignment.Bottom
properties.description:
Entries are displayed below the timeline axis.
In a vertical timeline, entries are displayed to the right of the timeline axis. Synonym for Right.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.TimelineAlignment.Left
properties.description:
Entries are displayed to the left of the timeline axis.
In a horizontal timeline, entries are displayed above the timeline axis. Synonym for Top.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.TimelineAlignment.Right
properties.description:
Entries are displayed to the right of the timeline axis.
In a horizontal timeline, entries are displayed below the timeline axis. Synonym for Bottom.

properties.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.TimelineAlignment.Top
properties.description:
Entries are displayed above the timeline axis.
In a vertical timeline, entries are displayed to the left of the timeline axis. Synonym for Left.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.TimelineItem
symbols.description: An entry posted on the timeline.

properties.name: dateTime
properties.description:
Date and time value of the timeline post. This value must be in one of the following formats:

  • A valid instance of the Date object.
  • An integer representing Unix time (also known as POSIX or Epoch time) in milliseconds.
  • A string with an integer representing Unix time in milliseconds.
  • A string that contains Date([number]), where [number] represents Unix time in milliseconds.
If this property has any other format, the timeline will try to parse it using Date.parse. It is not recommended to use this functionality, as different web browsers implement this function differently, which may lead to unpredictable behavior.

properties.name: filterValue
properties.description: Text for the items filter name. This text will be used as the name of the items filter in the filter popover.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Icon on the timeline axis that corresponds to the point in time when the entry was posted. Posts can be displayed in chronological or reverse chronological order.

properties.name: iconTooltip
properties.description: Tooltip for an icon displayed on the timeline axis.

properties.name: maxCharacters
properties.description: The expand and collapse feature is set by default and uses 300 characters on mobile devices and 500 characters on desktop computers as limits. Based on these values, the text of the timeline post is collapsed once it reaches these character limits. In this case, only the specified number of characters is displayed. By clicking the More link, the entire text can be displayed. Clicking Less collapses the text. The application can set the value according to its needs.

properties.name: replyCount
properties.description: Number of replies to a timeline post.

properties.name: status
properties.description:
Indicates the post status. The status affects the post's icon color. Supported values:

  • Information
  • Success
  • Warning
  • Error

properties.name: text
properties.description: Text shown inside the timeline post.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Text shown in the post title right after the user name.

properties.name: useIconTooltip
properties.description: Decides whether a default Icon tooltip should be used if no tooltip is set.

properties.name: userName
properties.description: User name shown in the post title.

properties.name: userNameClickable
properties.description: Makes the user name clickable. Clicking the name fires a userNameClicked event.

properties.name: userPicture
properties.description: Picture shown next to the user name.

aggregations.name: customAction
aggregations.description: Custom actions displayed as links in the links section of the post. The key must be unique for each link. Values are used as labels for the link. When a user clicks the link, a customActionClicked event is fired.

aggregations.name: customReply
aggregations.description: A UI5 control that acts as a custom reply dialog. It is used instead of the default reply dialog that is displayed when the user clicks the Reply link. Supports UI5 controls that have an openBy method, for example, the Popup control.

aggregations.name: embeddedControl
aggregations.description: A UI5 control that is displayed as a timeline post's content instead of the default content (text). Examples of such a control include the Panel control and the List control.

aggregations.name: replyList
aggregations.description: A list of replies related to the post.

aggregations.name: suggestionItems
aggregations.description:
Suggested posts.

methods.name: setDateTime

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oDateTime
parameters.description: New value for property dateTime

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property dateTime.

Date and time value of the timeline post. This value must be in one of the following formats:

  • A valid instance of the Date object.
  • An integer representing Unix time (also known as POSIX or Epoch time) in milliseconds.
  • A string with an integer representing Unix time in milliseconds.
  • A string that contains Date([number]), where [number] represents Unix time in milliseconds.
If this property has any other format, the timeline will try to parse it using Date.parse. It is not recommended to use this functionality, as different web browsers implement this function differently, which may lead to unpredictable behavior.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Icon on the timeline axis that corresponds to the point in time when the entry was posted. Posts can be displayed in chronological or reverse chronological order.

methods.name: setMaxCharacters

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: iMaxCharacters
parameters.description: New value for property maxCharacters

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property maxCharacters.

The expand and collapse feature is set by default and uses 300 characters on mobile devices and 500 characters on desktop computers as limits. Based on these values, the text of the timeline post is collapsed once it reaches these character limits. In this case, only the specified number of characters is displayed. By clicking the More link, the entire text can be displayed. Clicking Less collapses the text. The application can set the value according to its needs.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.util.ManagedObjectRegister
symbols.description:
A registry which keeps a set of managed objects and allows you to lazy load them and destroy them at once. A lot of controls keep those object as private properties and destroies them one by one. Instead you can just use: 


this._objectRegister = new ManagedObjectRegister();
this._objectRegister.register("Button", function() {
 return new Button(...);
});

this._objectRegister.getButton()...

this._objectRegister.destroyAll();

constructor.description: Creates an object registry for storing references to managed objects.

methods.name: destroyAll
methods.description: Destroys all objects in the registry and removes it's definition.

methods.name: destroyObject

parameters.name: sKey
parameters.description: Key of the object.

methods.description: Destroys an object and removes it from the registry.

symbols.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.ViewRepeater
symbols.description: This control extends the sap.ui.commons.RowRepeater control providing an ability to change data representation by switching between a number of views. The data can be displayed not only in rows but also in tiles that are adjusted to fill the entire horizontal space in a row.

properties.name: defaultViewIndex
properties.description: The index of the default view starting from 0. The view is selected on the initial rendering of the control. If the index is greater than the total quantity of the views, the last view is selected.

properties.name: external
properties.description: Indicates if the external representation of the current view is rendered.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the control. Only applicable if the responsive property is set to true.

properties.name: itemHeight
properties.description: The height of the tile in the current view in pixels. Only applicable if the responsive property is set to true. This value is used for calculating the number of tile rows.

properties.name: itemMinWidth
properties.description: The minimal width of the tile for the current view. Only applicable if "responsive" property is set to true.

properties.name: responsive
properties.description: This parameter indicates whether the content is shown in rows or tiles. If false, the content is shown in rows just like in core sap.ui.commons.RowRepeater. If true, the content is shown in tiles (similar to sap.ui.ux3.DataSet control) that have minimal width defined by the "itemMinWidth" property. The number of columns depends on the parent control's width. If you resize the control, the number of columns may change respectively so that the content tiles can fill the entire space of a row.

properties.name: showSearchField
properties.description: Indicates if the search field panel is shown.

properties.name: showViews
properties.description: Indicates if the view selector panel is shown.

aggregations.name: views
aggregations.description: The list of views for the data representation.

associations.name: externalRepresentation
associations.description: The control to be rendered instead of the repeater's own content.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new ViewRepeater.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

This parameter indicates whether the content is shown in rows or tiles. If false, the content is shown in rows just like in core sap.ui.commons.RowRepeater. If true, the content is shown in tiles (similar to sap.ui.ux3.DataSet control) that have minimal width defined by the "itemMinWidth" property. Default value is false.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.Status
nodes.description:
The status element holds information about a custom status that can be applied to nodes, lines, and groups of nodes.

You can create multiple custom statuses and assign them to your graph using the statuses aggregation of the sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.Graph control.

Alternatively, you can use default statuses provided by the sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.ElementStatus element.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.networkgraph.util.Dijkstra

nodes.description: Shape that consists of a single SVG path element.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.statusindicator.PropertyThreshold
nodes.description: Property threshold defines how the shapes included in the status indicator should be filled when the status indicator's percentage value is below the given threshold.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.statusindicator.Rectangle
nodes.description: Status indicator shape in the form of a rectangle.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.statusindicator.Shape
nodes.description: Abstract shape that displays the value of the status indicator.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.statusindicator.ShapeGroup
nodes.description: Group of shapes that display status indicator value.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.statusindicator.SimpleShape
nodes.description: A simple shape that consists of a single SVG shape.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.statusindicator.SizeType
nodes.description: Predefined sizes of the status indicator.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.statusindicator.StatusIndicator
nodes.description: The status indicator control displays a value between 0 and 100.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.statusindicator.VerticalAlignmentType
nodes.description: The vertical alignment of the status indicator within its parent container.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.taccount.TAccount
nodes.description: The T account control displays debit and credit entries on a general ledger account.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.taccount.TAccountGroup
nodes.description: The T account group control displays debit and credit entries for all sap.suite.ui.commons.TAccount controls included in the group.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.taccount.TAccountItem
nodes.description: The T account item control represents a credit or debit entry on a sap.suite.ui.commons.TAccount.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.taccount.TAccountItemProperty
nodes.description: An additional property that defines how a sap.suite.ui.commons.TAccountItem is displayed.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.taccount.TAccountPanel
nodes.description:
A panel that acts as a container for sap.suite.ui.commons.TAccountGroup controls included in it.
The settings dialog of the panel can be used to modify how the sap.suite.ui.commons.TAccountItem elements in the included T accounts are displayed.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.taccount.TAccountPanelState
nodes.description: The state of the sap.suite.ui.commons.taccount.TAccountPanel that defines how T accounts included in the panel are displayed.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.util.HtmlElement
nodes.description: HtmlElement A model class for holding information about one HTML tag.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.util.HtmlElementRenderer
nodes.description: HtmlElementRenderer A renderer for HtmlElement.

nodes.name: sap.suite.ui.commons.util.ManagedObjectRegister
nodes.description: A registry which keeps a set of managed objects and allows you to lazy load them and destroy them at once.
